AccountAccountRelation.name: AccountAccountRelation
AccountAccountRelation.description: Represents a relationship between accounts, such as a relationship between a business account and a household account.

AccountId.description: ID of the account associated with this account account relationship.

EndDate.description: The date when the relationship ends.

HierarchyType.description: Specifies the hierarchy between accounts that are related. For example, an account is related to another account as a parent, peer, or child.

IsActive.description: Indicates whether the account is actively involved with the related account.

LastReferencedDate.description: The timestamp when the current user last accessed this record, a record related to this record, or a list view.

LastViewedDate.description: The timestamp when the current user last viewed this record or list view. If this value is null, the user might have only accessed this record or list view (<parmname>LastReferencedDate</parmname>) but not viewed it.

Name.description: Name of the account account relationship.

OwnerId.description: ID of the owner of this object.

RelatedAccountId.description: The related account in the relationship.

RelatedInverseRecordId.description: The record that specifies the inverse relationship between the accounts.

StartDate.description: The date when the relationship starts.

AccountContactRelation.name: AccountContactRelation
AccountContactRelation.description: Standard and custom fields extend the standard Account object for use in Public Sector Solutions to represent information of members in a household

DataRollupCategories.description: Specifies the categories in which the data associated with a group is aggregated.

EndDate.description: The date a relationship between a contact and account ended. Use with the Start Date to keep a history of the relationship.

IsActive.description: Indicates whether relationship is active (true) or not (false).

IsDirect.description: Indicates whether relationship is direct (true) or not (false).

IsIncludedInGroup.description: Indicates whether the data of a group or a business account is included in the Household (true) or not (false).

IsPrimaryGroup.description: Indicates whether the group is a primary group for the member (yes) or not (no).

IsPrimaryMember.description: Indicates whether the member is a primary contact of a group (true) or not (false).

StartDate.description: The date a relationship between a contact and account began. Use with the End Date to keep a history of the relationship

AccountingFieldMapping.name: AccountingFieldMapping
AccountingFieldMapping.description: Represents the custom field mappings used to populate transaction journal records with other Salesforce data.

AccountingModelConfigId.description: The accounting set associated with the accounting field mapping record.

DeveloperName.description: The name of the person who created the accounting field mapping.

IsForAllocationType.description: Determines whether this supplemental mapping applies to transaction journal records of allocation type (true) or not (false).

IsForPaymentType.description: Determines whether this supplemental mapping applies to transaction journal records of payment type (true) or not (false).

IsForTransactionType.description: Determines whether this supplemental mapping applies to transaction journal records of transaction type (true) or not (false).

MappingBehavior.description: If set to PointInTime, the target field's data is mapped from the source field only when the transaction journal record is created. If set to CurrentValue, Accounting Subledger reverses and replaces the generated transaction journal records when the value on the transaction journal record is different from the source field value (for example, when you update the source field or the generated record).

MasterLabel.description: The standard name of the accounting set on the UI.

NamespacePrefix.description: The namespace prefix of the accounting set.

SourceField.description: The API name of the field on the source object that is mapped to the target field.

TargetField.description: The API name of the field on the transaction journal record for this mapping.

AccountingModelConfig.name: AccountingModelConfig
AccountingModelConfig.description: Represents settings for the accounting models used with Accounting Subledger. Accounting models are based on accounting sets, which include details about what accounting data is used and how.

DefaultAccrualAccountCode.description: The name of the default accrual account.

DefaultWriteOffAccountCode.description: The name of the account for payments that are written off.

DeveloperName.description: The name of the person who created the accounting set.

EarliestCreatedDate.description: Source records with a primary record Created Date that is older than this date are not considered part of this mapping set.

ExpectedCashFlowGrouping.description: Determines how transaction journal records are generated for expected revenue scenarios.

FullName.description: The unique name for the accounting set record.

InternalMappingDetails.description: JSON that is used to transmit financial data to Accounting Subledger for processing.

IsActive.description: Determines whether Accounting Subledger processes this accounting set (true) or not (false).

IsUsed.description: Determines whether the accounting set was used or activated at least once. If it was, you can't select another object for the object model, or change its number of objects.

MasterLabel.description: The standard name of the accounting set on the UI.

NamespacePrefix.description: The namespace prefix of the accounting set.

PaidCashFlowGrouping.description: Specifies how journal entries are generated for expense scenarios.

RecordTypeFilter.description: Information is generated only for records whose primary record’s record type is listed. If no record types are defined, all source records are considered eligible. The value is case-sensitive, and a semicolon-delimited API name.

RunOrder.description: Specifies the sequence in which the accounting set is processed if there is more than one. The Accounting Subledger job processes the accounting set with the lower number first. For example, run order 1 is processed before run order 2.

ActionPlan.name: ActionPlan
ActionPlan.description: Represents the instance of an action plan, a set of tasks created from an action plan template.

ActionPlanState.description: The status of work being done for the action plan.

ActionPlanTemplateVersionId.description: The ID of the version of the action plan template used to create this action plan. At creation, the referenced action plan template must be in the published state.

IsLocked.description: Indicates whether the action plan is locked or not.

IsUsingHolidayHours.description: Indicates whether task completion dates have been calculated by incrementing the task offset for each non-work day, excluding recurring holidays.

LastReferencedDate.description: The most recent date on which a user referenced this record.

LastViewedDate.description: The most recent date on which a user viewed this record.

MayEdit.description: Indicates whether the action plan can be edited or not.

Name.description: The name of the action plan.

OwnerId.description: The ID of the user who owns this record.

StartDate.description: The start date of the action plan.

TargetId.description: The ID of the parent object record that relates to this action plan. For API version 63.0 and later, supported parent objects are Account, AccountPlanObjective, Applicant, ApplicationForm, ApplicationFormProduct, Asset, BusinessLicense, BusinessMilestone, Campaign, Case, ChangeRequest, Claim, Contact, Contract, FinancialGoal, Incident, InsurancePolicy, InsurancePolicyCoverage, Lead, Opportunity, PersonLifeEvent, Problem, ResidentialLoanApplication, WorkOrder, and WorkOrderLineItem. For API version 62.0 and later, supported parent objects are ApplicationFormEvaluation and VettingEvaluation. For API version 48.0 and later, supported parent objects are Account, AssetsAndLiabilities, BusinessMilestone, Campaign, Card, Case, Claim, Contact, Contract, Financial Account, Financial Goal, Financial Holding, InsurancePolicy, InsurancePolicyCoverage, Lead, Opportunity, PersonLifeEvent, ResidentialLoanApplication, and Visit as well as custom objects with activities enabled. For API version 47.0 and later, supported parent objects are Account, BusinessMilestone, Campaign, Case, Claim, Contact, Contract, InsurancePolicy, InsurancePolicyCoverage, Lead, Opportunity, PersonLifeEvent, and Visit as well as custom objects with activities enabled. For API version 46.0 and later, supported parent objects are Account, Campaign, Case, Contact, Contract, Lead, and Opportunity as well as custom objects with activities enabled. For API version 45.0 and earlier, the only supported parent object is Account.

ActionPlanBaseTemplateAsgn.name: ActionPlanBaseTemplateAsgn
ActionPlanBaseTemplateAsgn.description: Represents a junction between an action plan template and a related record. An action plan template can be assigned to a job position, position, or a recruitment requisition.

ActionPlanTemplateId.description: ID of the action plan template that's associated with the reference record.

IsApplicable.description: Indicates whether the action plan base template assignment applies to the reference record (true) or not (false).

IsRequired.description: Indicates whether the action plan base template assignment is required (true) or not (false).

LastReferencedDate.description: The timestamp for when the current user last viewed a record related to this record.

LastViewedDate.description: The timestamp for when the current user last viewed this record. If this value is null, it’s possible that this record was referenced (LastReferencedDate) and not viewed.

Name.description: The name of the action plan base template assignment.

ReferenceRecordId.description: ID of the record that's associated with the action plan template.

Status.description: Specifies the status of the assignment.

TemplateDisplayOrder.description: The display order of the action plan template within the context of the reference record.

ActionPlanItem.name: ActionPlanItem
ActionPlanItem.description: Represents the instance of an action plan item.

ActionPlanId.description: The ID of the action plan that this item belongs to.

ActionPlanTemplateItemId.description: The ID of the action plan template item this item was created from.

IsLocked.description: Indicates whether this action plan item is locked or not. The default value is false.

IsRequired.description: Indicates whether this action plan item is required or not.

ItemEntityType.description: The type of object used with the item. This field is available in API version 61.0 and later.

ItemId.description: The ID of the record created by this action plan item. This field is a polymorphic relationship field.

ItemState.description: The action plan item’s work state.

Name.description: The name of this action plan item.

ActionPlanTemplate.name: ActionPlanTemplate
ActionPlanTemplate.description: Represents the instance of an action plan template.

ActionPlanType.description: This action plan template’s type. Possible values are: Industries Sales—This value is available in API version 63.0 and later with the Sales Action Plans add-on license and the Sales Action Plans default permission set. Service

Category.description: Specifies the category that the action plan template belongs to.Available in API version 64.0 and later.

Description.description: The description of this action plan template.

EstimatedCompletionDays.description: The estimated number of days to complete the action plan.Available in API version 64.0 and later.

FileBasedTemplatePath.description: The path of the file based template using which the action plan template is created.Available in API version 64.0 and later.

IsAdHocItemCreationEnabled.description: Indicates whether users can add tasks or other items to generated action plans (true) or not (false).

IsLocked.description: Indicates whether this action plan template is locked or not. The default value is false.

LastReferencedDate.description: The most recent date on which a user referenced this record.

LastViewedDate.description: The most recent date on which a user viewed this record.

MayEdit.description: Indicates whether this action plan template can be edited or not. The default value is false.

Name.description: The name of this action plan template.

OwnerId.description: The ID of the user who owns this action plan template. This field is a polymorphic relationship field.

SourceType.description: Specifies the source type to which the action plan template belongs to.Available in API version 64.0 and later.

Status.description: The status of this action plan template.

Subcategory.description: The subcategory to which the action plan template belongs.Available in API version 64.0 and later.

TargetEntityType.description: The parent object this action plan template relates to. Possible values are organized by the API version in which they were introduced. Values are available in all versions after introduction unless noted otherwise. API Version 62.0 and later with Financial Services: AccountPlanObjective FinancialDeal PartyProfile API Version 62.0 and later with Public Sector Solutions: ApplicationFormEvaluation VettingEvaluation API version 60.0 and later with Education Cloud ProgramEnrollment API version 58.0 and later with Health Cloud CareBarrier API version 58.0 and later with Nonprofit Cloud: Benefit Program API Version 58.0 and later with Public Sector Solution and Education Cloud: ApplicationDecision ApplicationReview Benefit Program API Version 56.0 and later with Automotive Cloud: Account Asset Asset Account Participant Asset Contact Participant Asset Milestone Fleet Lead Opportunity Record Alert Vehicle Case Claim Contact API Version 58.0 and later with Grantmaking: ApplicationDecision ApplicationReview Benefit Budget BudgetAllocation CareBarrier FundingAward FundingAwardAmendment FundingAwardRequirement FundingDisbursement FundingOpportunity Program API Version 52.0 and later: BusinessLicenseApplication IndividualApplication PublicComplaint RegulatoryCodeViolation ViolationEnforcementAction API Version 47.0 and later: BusinessMilestone Claim InsurancePolicy InsurancePolicyCoverage PersonLifeEvent Visit API Version 46.0 and later: Campaign—Unsupported for Grantmaking. Case Contact Contract Lead Opportunity Custom objects with activities enabled API Version 44.0 and later: Account

UniqueName.description: The unique name for this action plan template. This field is unique within your organization.

ActionPlanTemplateAssignment.name: ActionPlanTemplateAssignment
ActionPlanTemplateAssignment.description: Represents a junction between an action plant template's version and the target object associated with them.

ActionPlanTemplateVersionId.description: Required. The ActionPlanTemplateVersion associated with the TargetObject.

AssociatedObjectId.description: Required. Represents the relation between an object associated with the action plan template version record.

IsApplicable.description: Indicates whether the action plan template assignment applies to the reference record (true) or not (false).

IsRequired.description: Indicates whether the action plan template assignment is required (true) or not (false).

LastReferencedDate.description: The most recent date on which a user referenced this record.

LastViewedDate.description: The most recent date on which a user viewed this record.

Name.description: The unique ID of the Action Plan Template Assignment.

Status.description: Specifies the status of the action plan template assignment.

TemplateDisplayOrder.description: The display order of the action plan template within the context of the reference record.

ActionPlanTemplateItem.description: Represents the instance of an item on an action plan template version.

ActionPlanTemplateVersionId.description: The version of the action plan template this item is for.

LastReferencedDate.description: The most recent date on which a user referenced this record.

Name.description: The unique identifier for this action plan template item record.

ActionPlanTemplateItemId.description: The action plan template item that is associated with the assessment indicator definition.

AssessmentIndDefinitionId.description: The assessment indicator definition that is associated with the action plan template item.

LastViewedDate.description: The most recent date on which a user viewed this record.

ApplicationDecision.name: ApplicationDecision
ApplicationDecision.description: Represents a final decision performed for the specified Application.
Specifies the decision for the application.

Comment.description: The information about the decision provided on the application.

DecisionAuthorityId.description: The user responsible for the application decision.

LastReferencedDate.description: The timestamp for when the current user last viewed a record related to this record.

LastViewedDate.description: The timestamp for when the current user last viewed this record.

Name.description: Name of the preliminary application.

OwnerId.description: ID of the owner who owns the record.

PreliminaryApplicationRefId.description: The ID of the preliminary application reference.

ApplicationForm.name: ApplicationForm
ApplicationForm.description: Represents the high level information of a submitted application.

AccountId.description: The account that's associated with the application.

ApplicationSummary.description: A summary of the information provided in the application.

LastReferencedDate.description: The timestamp for when the current user last viewed a record related to this record.

LastViewedDate.description: The timestamp for when the current user last viewed this record. If this value is null, it’s possible that this record was referenced (LastReferencedDate) and not viewed.

LeadId.description: The ID of the lead associated with the application.

Name.description: Required. The name of the application form.

OpportunityId.description: The ID of the opportunity associated with the application.

OwnerId.description: ID of the user who created the record.

PreliminaryApplicationRefId.description: The preliminary application reference that represents the saved application.

RecruitmentPostingId.description: The recruitment posting associated with the application form.

Score.description: Indicates how well the application matches the posted requirements.

Score Reason.description: The information about the score provided on the application form.

Score Type.description: Specifies how the score is used for the application form.

Stage.description: The stage in the approval process of the application.

SubmissionDate.description: The date when the application is submitted.

ApplicationRenderMethod.description: Represents how a part of an application can be rendered.

Assessment.description: Stores the header data for an assessment.

Name.description: The Decision Matrix name.

OwnerId.description: The ID of the user who currently owns this matrix. Default value is the user logged in to the API to perform the create action.

Type.description: The Decision Matrix type. A Standard Decision Matrix has no special features. A Grouped Decision Matrix groups rows by one or two keys (GroupKey and SubGroupKey) such as geographic region or product code.

UniqueName.description: The unique identifier of the record, which is sourced from the value in the Name field of CalculationMatrix (decision matrix). For example, if the name of the calculation matrix is sample matrix, its UniqueName would be sample_matrix.

CalculationMatrixColumn.name: CalculationMatrixColumn
CalculationMatrixColumn.description: Defines a column in a Decision Matrix. The label for this object is Decision Matrix Column.

CalculationMatrixId.description: The ID of the Decision Matrix to which this column belongs.

ColumnType.description: Specifies whether the column matches matrix input or is returned as output.

DataType.description: The type of data in the column.

DisplaySequence.description: The position of this column in the column order.

IsWildcardColumn.description: Specifies that this column can contain a wildcard value such as ALL.

Name.description: The column name.

RangeValues.description: A list of values that define range boundaries.

WildcardColumnValue.description: The value that indicates a wildcard, for example ALL. Applicable if IsWildcardColumn is true.

CalculationMatrixRow.name: CalculationMatrixRow
CalculationMatrixRow.description: Defines a row in a Decision Matrix. The label for this object is Decision Matrix Row.

EndDateTime.description: The last date on which this row version is active. Applicable if IsVersionEnabled is true.

InputData.description: The input columns and associated values for this row of the matrix.

IsVersionEnabled.description: Specifies whether the associated matrix version is active. Derived from the associated Decision Matrix Version (CalculationMatrixVersion object).

OutputData.description: The output columns and associated values for this row of the matrix.

StartDateTime.description: The first date on which this row version is active. Applicable if IsVersionEnabled is true.

CalculationMatrixVersion.name: CalculationMatrixVersion
CalculationMatrixVersion.description: Defines a version of a Decision Matrix. The label for this object is Decision Matrix Version.

ApiName.description: The API name of the decision matrix version. This field is available in API version 56.0 and later.

CalculationMatrixId.description: The ID of the Decision Matrix to which this version belongs.

DecisionMatrixDefinitionVerId.description: The decision matrix definition version associated with this calculation matrix version.

EndDateTime.description: The last date on which this matrix version is active.

GroupKey.description: A key for grouping matrix rows in different versions, such as geographic region or product code. Derived from the associated Decision Matrix (CalculationMatrix object).

GroupKeyValue.description: The value of the GroupKey for this version. For example, if the GroupKey is Country, the GroupKeyValue can be United States.

IsEnabled.description: Specifies whether this version is active.

LoadProcessStatus.description: The status of a data upload from a .csv file.

MatrixType.description: The matrix type, either Standard or Grouped. A Grouped Decision Matrix groups rows in different Decision Matrix Versions by one or two keys such as geographic region or product code. Derived from the associated Decision Matrix (CalculationMatrix object).

Name.description: The matrix version name.

Rank.description: When the invocation time of a matrix call is between the StartDateTime and EndDateTime of more than one enabled matrix version, the version with the highest Rank is chosen.

StartDateTime.description: The first date on which this matrix version is active.

SubGroupKey.description: A subkey for grouping matrix rows in different versions, such as geographic region or product code. For example, if the GroupKey is Country, the SubGroupKey can be State or Province. Derived from the associated Decision Matrix (CalculationMatrix object).

SubGroupKeyValue.description: The value of the SubGroupKey for this version. For example, if the SubGroupKey is State or Province, the SubGroupKeyValue can be California.

CustodyItemRelation.description: Represents the relationship between a custody item and the context in which it’s held. For example, a custody item related to a case or case proceeding.

Employee2.description: Represents an employee within a company or an organization.

Name.description: The name of the employee record.

StatusEndDate.description: The planned end date for the employee’s status.

StatusStartDate.description: The start date of the employee’s current status.

Employment.name: Employment
Employment.description: Represents the details of an individual's employment with an organization.

Description.description: The description of the employment.

EffectiveFromDate.description: The date when the employment is effective.

EffectiveToDate.description: The date when the employment is no longer effective.

Employee2Id.description: The ID of the employee2 record associated with the employment.

EmployeeUserId.description: The ID of the employee's user record.

EmploymentOffer.description: Represents an employment offer for a selected candidate.

ExpectedHireDate.description: The expected hire date of employment.

ExpectedStartDate.description: The expected start date of employment.

ManagerId.description: The manager associated with the employment offer.

EmploymentOfferVettingEval.description: Represents a junction between an employment offer and a vetting evaluation of the offer recipient.

EngagementAttendee.name: EngagementAttendee
EngagementAttendee.description: Represents information about an attendee of an engagement. For example, when a customer initiates an engagement interaction by calling a service representative to inquire about an insurance claim, this object stores information about the customer and the service representative.

EndDateTime.description: The date and time when the engagement with the attendee ends.

EngagementId.description: Required. The engagement interaction, messaging session, or voice call that’s related to the attendee.

ExternalAttendeeId.description: The external user related to the engagement, such as the customer or partner. To avoid an error, either this field or the InternalAttendeeId field must have a value.

InternalAttendeeId.description: The internal user related to the engagement, such as the call center agent. To avoid an error, either this field or the ExternalAttendeeId field must have a value.

IsAuthenticated.description: Indicates whether the initiating attendee of the engagement interaction was authenticated through interactive voice response (IVR) or Web channel (true) or not (false). The default value is false.

IsVerified.description: Indicates whether the initiating attendee of the engagement interaction was verified (true) or not (false). The default value is false.

LastReferencedDate.description: The timestamp when the current user last accessed this record, a record related to this record, or a list view.

LastViewedDate.description: The timestamp when the current user last viewed this record or list view. If this value is null, the user might have only accessed this record or list view (LastReferencedDate) but not viewed it.

Name.description: The name of the Engagement Attendee record.

OwnerId.description: The Salesforce ID of the person who owns this engagement attendee record.

RecordTypeId.description: The identifier of the record type object. Available in API version 65.0 and later.

Role.description: The role of an engagement attendee. This field is available in API version 56.0 and later. Possible values are: OnBehalf Self

StartDateTime.description: Required. The date and time when the engagement with the attendee starts.

VerificationTime.description: The time when the attendee was verified for the engagement interaction. This field is available in API version 56.0 and later.

EngagementInteraction.name: EngagementInteraction
EngagementInteraction.description: Represents information about an interaction between a service representative or any other specialist in an organization and the organization’s customer. Engagement interactions can be initiated through communication channels and can cover one or more topics. For example, a customer can initiate an engagement interaction by calling a service representative to inquire about an insurance claim.

AttendeeVerificationTime.description: The time when the attendee was verified for the engagement interaction. You can manually set this time. If isAttendeeVerified is set to true, then if you don’t manually set this time, it’s set based on the current system date and time.

CommunicationChannel.description: Required. The communication channel through which engagement interaction occurs.

ContextId.description: The ID of the record that’s considered as the context for the engagement interaction. For example, when a customer initiates an engagement interaction by booking a service appointment for an inquiry, the service appointment is the context for that engagement interaction.

Duration.description: Read-only. The duration of the engagement interaction based on the start date time and end date time. The duration is calculated when the end time is updated.

EndDateTime.description: The date and time when the engagement interaction ends.

ExternalIdentifier.description: The unique external identifier of the engagement interaction.

InitiatingAttendeeId.description: The attendee who initiated the engagement interaction.

IsAttendeeAuthenticated.description: Indicates whether the initiating attendee of the engagement interaction has been authenticated through IVR or Web channel (true) or not (false).

IsAttendeeVerified.description: Indicates whether the initiating attendee of the engagement interaction has been verified (true) or not (false).

LastReferencedDate.description: The timestamp when the current user last accessed this record, a record related to this record, or a list view.

LastViewedDate.description: The timestamp when the current user last viewed this record or list view. If this value is null, the user might have only accessed this record or list view (LastReferencedDate) but not viewed it.

MappedState.description: Specifies the state of the engagement interaction that changes when the status of the interaction gets updated.

Name.description: The name of the Engagement Interaction record.

OwnerId.description: The Salesforce ID of the person who owns this engagement interaction record.

PhoneNumber.description: The phone number of the caller to get the context about the previous engagement interaction. This field is available in API version 57.0 and later.

Reason.description: The reason for the engagement as stated by the customer or their representative during the engagement interaction. This field is available from API version 56.0 and later.

RecordTypeId.description: The identifier of the record type object. Available in API version 62.0 and later.

Sentiment.description: The analyzed sentiment of the engagement interaction attendee about the engagement interaction.

StartDateTime.description: Required. The date and time when the engagement interaction starts.

Status.description: Specifies the status of the engagement interaction, which also impacts the interaction state.

Type.description: Specifies the type of interaction that was initiated by the attendee.

EngagementTopic.name: EngagementTopic
EngagementTopic.description: Represents information about the topics discussed by a customer and other attendees during an engagement. For example, when a customer initiates an engagement interaction by calling a service representative to inquire about an insurance claim, the topic of the engagement is Claim.

EngagementId.description: The engagement interaction, messaging session, or voice call record that’s related to the topic discussed during the engagement.

InteractionSummary.description: The summary of the engagement interaction. This field is available in API version 56.0 and later.

LastReferencedDate.description: The timestamp when the current user last accessed this record, a record related to this record, or a list view.

LastViewedDate.description: The timestamp when the current user last viewed this record or list view. If this value is null, the user might have only accessed this record or list view (LastReferencedDate) but not viewed it.

Name.description: Required. The name of the engagement topic record.

OwnerId.description: The Salesforce ID of the person who owns this engagement topic record.

ParentTopicId.description: The parent engagement topic record that’s associated with this engagement topic.

ProcessFailureReason.description: Specifies the reason the process failed during the engagement interaction. The source is selected from a picklist of available values, which are set by your Salesforce administrator.

ProcessName.description: The name of the process executed during the engagement interaction.

ProcessStatus.description: Specifies the current status of the process that’s executed during the engagement interaction.

ProcessType.description: The type of the process executed during the engagement interaction.

RecordTypeId.description: The identifier of the record type object. Available in API version 65.0 and later.

RelatedPersonId.description: The person for whom the engagement interaction has been initiated.

TopicId.description: The engagement topic record that’s associated with the parent engagement topic.

Examination.description: Represents information about the authorized examinations that qualify a license or permit.

LastViewedDate.description: The timestamp for when the current user last viewed this record.

Name.description: Name of the examination.

OwnerId.description: ID of the owner of this record.

Status.description: Status of this examination.

ExplainabilityMsgTemplateLocalization.name: ExplainabilityMsgTemplateLocalization
ExplainabilityMsgTemplateLocalization.description: Represents the translated value of the message in an explainability message template for an expression set step element.

Language.description: The language of the translated explainability message template.

NamespacePrefix.description: The namespace prefix that is associated with this object. Each Developer Edition org that creates a managed package has a unique namespace prefix. Limit: 15 characters. You can refer to a component in a managed package by using the namespacePrefix__componentName notation. This is a required field.The namespace prefix can have one of the following values. In Developer Edition orgs, NamespacePrefix is set to the namespace prefix of the org for all objects that support it, unless an object is in an installed managed package. In that case, the object has the namespace prefix of the installed managed package. This field’s value is the namespace prefix of the Developer Edition org of the package developer. In orgs that are not Developer Edition orgs, NamespacePrefix is set only for objects that are part of an installed managed package. All other objects have no namespace prefix.

ParentId.description: The Id of the related explainability message template.

Value.description: The translated label of the explainability message template.

ExpressionSet.name: ExpressionSet
ExpressionSet.description: Represents information about an expression set. An expression set performs a series of calculations using lookups and user-defined variables and constants.

ApiName.description: The API name of the expression set. This field is unique within your organization. This is a required field.

Description.description: The description of the expression set.

ExecutionScale.description: Specifies the scale of the input that an expression set processes. The scale determines where the expression set is executed.

ExpressionSetDefinitionId.description: The expression set definition record associated with this expression set. This is a required field.

LastReferencedDate.description: The timestamp when the current user last accessed this record, a record related to this record, or a list view.

LastViewedDate.description: The timestamp when the current user last viewed this record or list view. If this value is null, it's possible the user only accessed this record or list view (LastReferencedDate) but didn't view it.

Name.description: The name of the expression set. This is a required field.

OwnerId.description: The ID of the user who currently owns this expression set. Default value is the user logged in to the API to perform the create action

UsageType.description: The type of industry that’s using the expression set.

ExpressionSetDefinitionContextDefinition.name: ExpressionSetDefinitionContextDefinition
ExpressionSetDefinitionContextDefinition.description: Represents a relationship between an expression set definition and a context definition. This object is available in API version 58.0 and later.

ContextDefinitionApiName.description: API name of the context definition.

ExecutableContextDefinition.description: Developer name of the file-based context definition.

ExpressionSetApiName.description: API name of the expression set.

ExpressionSetDefinitionId.description: ID of the expression set definition.

ExpressionSetVersion.name: ExpressionSetVersion
ExpressionSetVersion.description: Represents information about a specific version of an expression set. This object is also accessible through the UI API, which enables its use in components like Lightning Web Components (LWC).

ApiName.description: The API name of the expression set version. This is a required field and it requires a unique value.

Description.description: The description of the expression set version,

DecimalScale.description: The number of decimal places to apply to non-local resources such as context tags.

EndDateTime.description: The date and time when the expression set version becomes inactive.

ExpressionSetDefinitionVerId.description: The expression set definition version associated with this expression set version. This is a required field.

ExpressionSetId.description: The ID of the parent expression set record that’s associated with this expression set version. This is a required field.

IsActive.description: Indicates whether the expression set version is active (true) or not (false). This is a required field.

IsLoopingEnabled.description: Indicates whether looping is active for this expression set version (true) or not (false).

LatestSimulationResult.description: The result of the simulation service that processes the input variables defined for the expression set version, in JSON format.

LoopEndVariableName.description: The name of the resource that’s used to determine which resource can be processed last in the loop.

LoopIncrementVariableName.description: The name of the variable that’s used to determine which resource can be processed next in the loop.

LoopStartVariableName.description: The name of the variable that’s processed when the loop starts.

Name.description: The name of the expression set version. This is a required field.

Rank.description: The rank of the expression set version. An expression set version's rank is used to determine when the version is chosen for processing. When more than one enabled version matches an expression set call, and the start and end date time periods overlap, the version with the highest rank is chosen.

ShouldShowExplExternally.description: Indicates whether the decision explanation is exposed to external users (true) or not (false).

StartDateTime.description: The date and time when the expression set version becomes active.

VersionNumber.description: The version number of this expression set. This is a required field.

ExpressionSetView.name: ExpressionSetView
ExpressionSetView.description: Represents a virtual object that provides a consolidated view of file-based expression set. File-based expression sets are read-only templates. To be able to modify file-based expression sets, you must clone them first.

Description.description: The description of an expression set.

DurableId.description: The ID of the expression set.

ExpressionSetDetails.description: The details of the expression set in JSON format, which includes information such as name, version, created date, and elements contained in the expression set.

HasContextDefinitionRef.description: Indicates whether the executable expression set template references an executable context definition (true) or not (false). The default value is False.Available in API version 60.0 and later.

IsExecutable.description: Indicates whether the expression set template is executable (true) or not (false). Available in API version 60.0 and later.

IsTemplate.description: Indicates whether the expression set is a template (true) or not (false). When installed from managed packages, expression sets can’t be viewed or cloned by subscribers because of intellectual property (IP) protection. But when those expression sets are templates, subscribers can open them in a builder, clone them, and customize the clones.

LastModifiedBy.description: The name of the user that last updated the expression set view.

Name.description: The name of the file-based or database expression set.

NamespacePrefix.description: The namespace prefix that is associated with this object. Each Developer Edition org that creates a managed package has a unique namespace prefix. Limit: 15 characters. You can refer to a component in a managed package by using the namespacePrefix__componentName notation. The namespace prefix can have one of the following values. In Developer Edition orgs, NamespacePrefix is set to the namespace prefix of the org for all objects that support it, unless an object is in an installed managed package. In that case, the object has the namespace prefix of the installed managed package. This field’s value is the namespace prefix of the Developer Edition org of the package developer. In orgs that aren’t Developer Edition orgs, NamespacePrefix is set only for objects that are part of an installed managed package. All other objects have no namespace prefix.

UsageType.description: The type of industry or the application within the industry that's using the template.Available in API version 60.0 and later. Possible value is: Bre—Business Rules Engine When Business Rules Engine is enabled for a Salesforce instance, the default value is Bre. Other usage types may be available to you depending on your industry solution and permission sets.

UsageTypeLabel.description: Specifies the label of the usage type that's associated with an expression set template

ExpsSetObjectAliasFieldVw.name: ExpsSetObjectAliasFieldVw
ExpsSetObjectAliasFieldVw.description: Represents the virtual object that provides a consolidated view of source object and its alias, and the source object fields and their aliases that are used in an expression set. This object is used to check the permission level required to access the underlying object fields associated with their field aliases.

DurableId.description: The unique identifier for the field. Always retrieve this value before using it, as the value isn’t guaranteed to stay the same from one release to the next. Simplify queries by using this field instead of making multiple queries.

ExpsSetDefVerVarField.description: Identifies the variable to which this field belongs. This is a required field.

FieldAlias.description: The alias associated with the object field that's used in the expression set. The field alias can be up to 30 characters in length. This is a required field.

InstalledPackageName.description: The name of the package used to add the record to the org. This is a required field.

LastModifiedBy.description: The unique identifier of the user who modified the alias last. This is a required field.

ManageableState.description: Indicates the manageable state of the specified component that is contained in a package. This is a required field.

NamespacePrefix.description: The namespace prefix that is associated with this object. Each Developer Edition org that creates a managed package has a unique namespace prefix. Limit: 15 characters. You can refer to a component in a managed package by using the namespacePrefix__componentName notation. This is a required field.The namespace prefix can have one of the following values. In Developer Edition orgs, NamespacePrefix is set to the namespace prefix of the org for all objects that support it, unless an object is in an installed managed package. In that case, the object has the namespace prefix of the installed managed package. This field’s value is the namespace prefix of the Developer Edition org of the package developer. In orgs that are not Developer Edition orgs, NamespacePrefix is set only for objects that are part of an installed managed package. All other objects have no namespace prefix.

LinkedIdVerfProcessDetId.description: Configure multiple levels of identity verification. For example, suppose you have two process detail records, Contact Process Detail and Account Process Detail, and Account Process Detail is linked to the contact process detail record. In this case, the contact process detail record is used for primary verification and the account process detail record is used for secondary verification. Then, if your business requirement is to configure a third-level verification process, create another process detail record and set the value of the LinkedIdVerfProcessDetId field in the account process detail record to the third process detail record.
